title: Expressing Wishes and Regrets About Art and Culture
description: Practice expressing wishes, regrets, and preferences about cultural experiences using 'wish', 'if only', and related structures.

sentences.text: I wish I had learned to play an instrument when I was younger.
sentences.translation: 어렸을 때 악기를 배웠으면 좋았을 텐데.
sentences.tips: Use 'wish + past perfect' for past regrets.

sentences.text: If only I could afford tickets to the opera.
sentences.translation: 오페라 티켓을 살 여유가 있으면 좋을 텐데.
sentences.tips: Use 'if only + could' for present impossibilities.

sentences.text: I wish people wouldn't use their phones during performances.
sentences.translation: 사람들이 공연 중에 핸드폰을 사용하지 않았으면 좋겠다.
sentences.tips: Use 'wish + would' to express annoyance or desire for change.

sentences.text: If only the exhibition hadn't been so crowded yesterday.
sentences.translation: 어제 전시회가 그렇게 붐비지 않았으면 좋았을 텐데.
sentences.tips: Use 'if only + past perfect' for past regrets.

sentences.text: I wish I understood abstract art better.
sentences.translation: 추상 미술을 더 잘 이해했으면 좋겠다.
sentences.tips: Use 'wish + past simple' for present desires.

sentences.text: If only more theaters offered discounts for students.
sentences.translation: 더 많은 극장이 학생들에게 할인을 제공했으면 좋을 텐데.
sentences.tips: Use 'if only + past simple' for unreal present situations.

sentences.text: It's high time the government invested more in the arts.
sentences.translation: 정부가 예술에 더 많이 투자할 때가 됐다.
sentences.tips: Use 'It's high time + past simple' for overdue actions.

sentences.text: I'd rather the movie had a more original storyline.
sentences.translation: 그 영화가 더 독창적인 스토리라인을 가졌으면 좋겠다.
sentences.tips: Use 'would rather + past simple' for preferences about others.

sentences.text: I wish I had seen that play before it closed.
sentences.translation: 그 연극이 끝나기 전에 봤으면 좋았을 텐데.
sentences.tips: Use 'wish + past perfect' for missed opportunities.

sentences.text: If only classical music concerts weren't so expensive.
sentences.translation: 클래식 음악 콘서트가 그렇게 비싸지 않으면 좋을 텐데.
sentences.tips: Use 'if only + past simple' for complaints about present situations.

sentences.text: I wish I could paint as well as that artist.
sentences.translation: 저 예술가만큼 그림을 잘 그릴 수 있으면 좋겠다.
sentences.tips: Use 'wish + could' for abilities we don't have.

sentences.text: It's about time museums offered more interactive experiences.
sentences.translation: 박물관들이 더 많은 인터랙티브 경험을 제공할 때가 됐다.
sentences.tips: Use 'It's about time + past simple' for necessary changes.

lines.text: What did you think of the new film?
I wish it had been longer. The ending felt rushed.
Really? I thought it was fine. But I wish the dialogue had been stronger.
That's true. If only the screenplay had been written by someone more experienced.
The visuals were stunning though. I wish I could work on films like that.
Me too. If only we had studied film instead of business!
Don't remind me. I'd rather we'd followed our passions.
It's never too late to learn. There are evening classes available.
I wish I had more free time. Work takes up everything.
I know what you mean. It's about time we made time for creative pursuits.
Agreed. If only there were more hours in the day!
Well, at least we can still enjoy watching films, even if we can't make them.

items: Did you pronounce 'wish' and 'if only' clearly?

Did you transition naturally between different wish forms?

Did you participate naturally in the dialogue?
Did you use 'wish + past simple' for present situations?
Did you use 'wish + past perfect' for past regrets?
Did you use 'wish + would' for complaints correctly?
Did you use 'It's time + past simple' appropriately?
Did you express wishes and regrets appropriately?
Did you use arts and entertainment vocabulary?
Did you convey emotion through your tone?
